Al\xADter\xADna\xADtively, use the al\xADpha\xADbet test to set line length. You should be able to fit be\xADtween two and three al\xADpha\xADbets on your line"),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"p",components:components},React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"img",components:components,parentName:"p",props:{"src":"https://daks2k3a4ib2z.cloudfront.net/571514452b490af542a3138e/59b946dd3d68fd0001391c90_Typography%20102b.045.png","alt":null}})),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"h2",components:components,props:{"id":"font-size"}},"Font Size"),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"p",components:components},"Make the font size bigger on desktops as you sit further back (most of the time). You can get away with smaller font sizes on mobile as the viewer will often hold it closer to their face."),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"p",components:components},React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"img",components:components,parentName:"p",props:{"src":"https://daks2k3a4ib2z.cloudfront.net/571514452b490af542a3138e/59b9473a1016420001dfaeda_Typography%20102b.047.png","alt":null}})),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"h2",components:components,props:{"id":"good-summary"}},"Good Summary"),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"p",components:components},React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"img",components:components,parentName:"p",props:{"src":"https://daks2k3a4ib2z.cloudfront.net/571514452b490af542a3138e/59b949ebd5c9fd00013e7174_Typography%20102b.090.png","alt":null}})),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"h2",components:components,props:{"id":"-1"}}),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"hr",components:components}),React.createElement(MDXTag,{name:"h1",components:components,props:{"id":"thanks-thats-it"}},"Thanks that’s it."));}}]);return MDXContent;}(React.Component);export{MDXContent as default};MDXContent.__docgenInfo={"description":"","methods":[],"displayName":"MDXContent"};

sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"️-design-fundamentals-7-tricks-graphic-designers-dont-want-you-to-know"}}>{`✏️ Design fundamentals: 7 tricks graphic designers don’t want you to know`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="blockquote" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components} parentName="blockquote">{`A poorly planned talk by Scott Blissett – May 8, 2018
`}<MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525748404437_Slack_-_Present_Company.jpg","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The following tricks aren’t really tricks but some of the design fundamentals I learnt at uni. It’s been a while since I reviewed any of this so this talk is a good refresher for me and a good topic to talk about (hopefully).`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="hr" components={components}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"1-shapes"}}>{`#1 Shapes`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525922323251_1.png","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Lines are great and a used in every type design.
Lines give us visual indications of where something begins and ends.
They can be used to convey distance, feeling, shape, dimension.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525922783758_1+copy.png","alt":"3 flat circles"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525922878700_1+copy+2.png","alt":"Now its a wine glass wow. It has 3D shape now."}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"three-types-of-lines"}}>{`Three types of lines`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525923086895_1+copy+3.png","alt":"Actual lines have weight, length and emotion."}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525923167539_1+copy+4.png","alt":"Not a single but a series to make a single"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://static.seattletimes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/01222018_amazon-go-ringman_130017-1020x322.jpg","alt":"A lineup"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525924047561_1+copy+5.png","alt":"Mental connection between two points or elements."}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"vertical-vs-horizontal"}}><MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="h2">{`Vertical vs Horizontal`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`A psychic vertical line is viewed as having hierarchy.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1499792914147-5e4c9a4a9684?ixlib=rb-0.3.5&ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&s=161799cf6c9503ea10fbdb38afd88dca&dpr=1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1000&q=80&cs=tinysrgb","alt":"Vertical lines represents hierarchy, heavens, universe, ideas, more masculine."}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":""}}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525991824291_Grove.jpg","alt":"Horizontal lines between this copy and the image are seen to represent the “idea realised”, also the horizon, the feminine, and the passive."}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="hr" components={components}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"dots-and-circles"}}>{`Dots and Circles`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525992166876_-.png","alt":"The dot and circle represent perfect, completeness and freedom from distinction or seperation. Can suggest community, friendship, love, unity."}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Olympic_rings_without_rims.svg/2000px-Olympic_rings_without_rims.svg.png","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"http://www.siliconbeat.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Uber-new-logo.png","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"http://www.artisticquiltdesign.com/wp-content/uploads/top-15-famous-brands-with-circle-logo-circle-logos.jpg","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="hr" components={components}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525992504677_1+copy+6.png","alt":"Suggest stability, imply balance. Straight lines and precise shapes represent strength, professionalism and efficiency. Triangles are often associated with power, science, religion and law."}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/7b/Adobe_Systems_logo_and_wordmark.svg","alt":null}}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/LEGO_logo.svg/2000px-LEGO_logo.svg.png","alt":"Image result for lego logo"}}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"http://www.carlogos.org/logo/Tesla-logo-2003-2500x2500.png","alt":"Image result for tesla logo"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="hr" components={components}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"2-negative-space"}}>{`#2 Negative Space`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Negative space what “carries” the subject of an image. The negative space will create a shape itself. A good design’s composition will always consider the balance of positive and negative space. Just as important as that object itself, negative space helps to define the boundaries of positive space and brings balance to a composition.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://digitalsynopsis.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/creative-logo-design-negative-space-33.jpg","alt":null}}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/2/24/WWF_logo.svg/1200px-WWF_logo.svg.png","alt":null}}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://3t827putmhzpysma2wygdaea-wpengine.netdna-ssl.com/sbrc/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/01_fedex.jpg","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://www.itsnicethat.com/system/files/072012/50165c375c3e3c4aa100075e/images_slice_large/fukuda_6.jpeg?1438258263","alt":"Image result for Shigeo Fukuda"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="hr" components={components}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"3-scale-proportion"}}>{`#3 Scale, Proportion`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"scale-and-proportion"}}>{`Scale and Proportion`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Scale and proportion both concern size.
Scale refers to overall size and proportion refers to relative size.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`They both are principles used to help the viewer organise and image and can create or minimise points of emphasis.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://i1.adis.ws/i/rapha/rapha_ss18_Argentina_Brevet_170_16x9?aspect=16:9&sm=aspect&scaleFit=poi&poi=%7B($this.metadata.pointOfInterest.w==0)?0.5:$this.metadata.pointOfInterest.x%7D,%7B($this.metadata.pointOfInterest.w==0)?0.5:$this.metadata.pointOfInterest.y%7D,%7B($this.metadata.pointOfInterest.w==0)?0:$this.metadata.pointOfInterest.w%7D,%7B($this.metadata.pointOfInterest.h==0)?0:$this.metadata.pointOfInterest.h%7D%7D&fmt.jpeg.interlaced=true&w=1500","alt":"We use nature and our body as the bases for our measurement reference. Hence why the first units of measurements were equivalent to a body part."}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`If objects are out-of-scale of oddly proportioned, the viewer will view it as a point of emphasis.
Large scale objects create weight and are associated with more importance than the smaller objects.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525995263873_Screen+Shot+2018-05-11+at+9.34.04+am.png","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://www.itsnicethat.com/system/files/032014/53345c945c3e3c037000100a/images_slice_large/1.jpg?1438269231","alt":"Jim Stoten"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://timedotcom.files.wordpress.com/2014/08/giant-rubber-duck.jpg","alt":"Florentijn Hofman"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="hr" components={components}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"4-symmetry-and-asymmetry"}}>{`#4 Symmetry and Asymmetry`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Good design is a core principle to a successful design.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`There is symmetrical balance which can be defined as something having a central axis dividing a composition through the middle, horizontally or vertically. Mirrored to each side. It creates a sense of security and solidity, the balance makes the viewer feel comfortable.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`There is pure symmetry (mirror image) and approximate symmetry (more appeal, variation on each side while remaining balanced).`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525996529017_dasprogramm_shop__T_3_pocket_radio__HfG_Ulm___Dieter_Rams_1958.jpg","alt":"Horizontal Symmetry"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525996562381_dasprogramm_shop__T_3_pocket_radio__HfG_Ulm___Dieter_Rams_1958.jpg","alt":"Influenced the first iPod"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/I/A1t8xCe9jwL._SY679_.jpg","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Asymmetrical balance is when both sides of the central axis are not identical, but appear to have equal weight. It’s an implied balance.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1525999212363_Disruption___For_Those_Changing_Their_Industries.jpg","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="hr" components={components}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"5-hierarchy"}}>{`#5 Hierarchy`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Basically it mean ranking, or classification of things according to relative importance.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`When this used in design it demonstrates how a viewer should move through the design. What they should see first second and third and last. It affects how a viewer will understand the information, how easy it is to intake and maintains control.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1526000004523_Rugby_Canada.jpg","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1526000130088_Airtable.jpg","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="hr" components={components}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"6-rhythm-pattern"}}>{`#6 Rhythm, Pattern`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"rhythm"}}>{`Rhythm`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The repetition or alteration of elements, often with defined intervals between them. Rhythm can create a sense of movement and establish patterns and texture. It creates a pulse or beat behind a design, like it does with music.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`There can be regular (similar intervals), flowing (sense of movement more organic) or progressive (progression of steps).`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1526001303426_www.apple.com_ipad_.png","alt":"Changing rhythm between elements, but regular."}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1526002520403_odc2017.com_.png","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"pattern"}}>{`Pattern`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://d2mxuefqeaa7sj.cloudfront.net/s_5594818096833C98BE67E017D04B0A135886FB67175E3EC47DE614BB14E75EC7_1526002300127_Nacho__Design_Creates_Value.jpg","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="hr" components={components}></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"7-typography-done-good"}}>{`#7 Typography done good`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Stole bits from `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"http://pierrickcalvez.com/journal/a-five-minutes-guide-to-better-typography"}}>{`http://pierrickcalvez.com/journal/a-five-minutes-guide-to-better-typography`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"sans-serif-vs-serif"}}>{`Sans Serif vs Serif`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://i.pinimg.com/originals/21/1b/7b/211b7b43e6342071f2d8aac6291c4eeb.gif","alt":"Image result for what is a serif"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`Why Serif?`}</MDXTag>{`
Those little bits are serifs, and help our eyes more easily recognise the the letters. It’s better to use a serif for smaller body copy as it’s easier to read in long form and smaller font sizes. That’s why newspapers do it.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`Sans Serif`}</MDXTag>{`
Are better for larger displays.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://practicaltypography.com/images/roadsign-standard.jpg","alt":"Fast and easy to read from distance."}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://practicaltypography.com/images/roadsign-script.jpg","alt":"This looks pretty, but not practical."}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"fonts"}}>{`Fonts`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Start with one, preferably that has lots of weights`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://daks2k3a4ib2z.cloudfront.net/571514452b490af542a3138e/59b93cfada0d170001122c1e_Typography%20102b.033.png","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://daks2k3a4ib2z.cloudfront.net/571514452b490af542a3138e/59b93d1d0c4f270001fb168c_Typography%20102b.035.png","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://daks2k3a4ib2z.cloudfront.net/571514452b490af542a3138e/59b93d6989764b00012d8b36_Typography%20102b.037.png","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"line-height"}}>{`Line height`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Line height is important for readability. For most text the optimal is between 1.2em and 1.45em. Not too dense not too sparse.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://daks2k3a4ib2z.cloudfront.net/571514452b490af542a3138e/59b9467bc0dd0b00011d2d13_Typography%20102b.041.png","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"line-length"}}>{`Line length`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The longer the line length the harder it is for your eye to trace back and find the next line. Between 40 and 80 characters per line is ideal. Less is more comfortable.
Al­ter­na­tively, use the al­pha­bet test to set line length. You should be able to fit be­tween two and three al­pha­bets on your line`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://daks2k3a4ib2z.cloudfront.net/571514452b490af542a3138e/59b946dd3d68fd0001391c90_Typography%20102b.045.png","alt":null}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"font-size"}}>{`Font Size`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Make the font size bigger on desktops as you sit further back (most of the time). You can get away with smaller font sizes on mobile as the viewer will often hold it closer to their face.`}</MDXTag>
